task-wr.title: Deleting an Alarm
task-wr.shortdesc: You can delete an alarm when it is not automatically cleared.

context.p: Manually deleting an alarm should not be done unless it is absolutely clear that there is no reason for the alarm to be active.

section.p: You can use the command system alarm-delete to manually delete an alarm that remains active for no apparent reason, which may happen in rare conditions. Alarms usually clear automatically when the trigger condition is corrected.

li.p: To delete an alarm, use the system alarm-delete command as shown below:~(keystone_admin)$ system alarm-delete 4ab5698a-19cb-4c17-bd63-302173fef62c
